page.title: 02Ayrshire Dairy Farming (1)
page.content: The 128 hectares (320 acres) that make up Altonhill Farm are mainly rented and partly owned by Mr.Archie Borland. Most of the rented land is in Kilmarnock Estates. The main enterprise is dairying. The 115 dairy cows are milked twice each day_once at 6am and again in the afternoon. Each year the herd produces 3/4 of a million litres of milk which is stored in a refrigerated bulk tank and collected daily by a road tanker and taken to Glasgow. The majority of the cows calve between August and October,with the remainder being spread throughout the year. Most of the female calves (heifers) are kept at the farm,reared as replacements for the dairy herd. Bull calves are sold at between three and four weeks old to be reared for beef.
